Araka Jātaka：The Bodhisatta was once born in a brahmin’s family and was named Araka; when he grew up he embraced the religious life and lived in the Himālaya as a teacher with a large following．He taught his pupils the value of the four brahmavihāras．After his death he was born in the Brahma-world and remained there for seven aeons．

The story was told to the monks at Jetavana in reference to theMetta Sutta （J．ii．60-2）．
